definition: to submerge/to immerse/to sink/to keep down/to lower/to drop/deep/profound/heavy

sentences.english: During the attack two Royal Australian Naval vessels, Kelat and Mavie, were sunk.
sentences.chinese: 空袭中澳大利亚皇家海军舰艇克拉特和玛威被击沉。

sentences.english: Waves on the mississippi swamped boats and washed others upon the shore .
sentences.chinese: 密西西比河的浪涛将船只击沉并将其它东西冲至岸上。

sentences.english: Three invading battleships were sunk at one stroke.
An international investigation concluded a North Korean torpedo hit the ship.
sentences.chinese: 国际调查的结论是，北韩鱼雷击沉了天安号。

sentences.english: The Japs claimed two battleships, three cruisers.
sentences.chinese: 日军声称击沉了2艘战舰，3艘巡洋舰。

sentences.english: British merchant cruiser had been sunk by German battle cruisers.
sentences.chinese: 一艘英国商业舰艇被德国的巡洋战舰击沉了。

sentences.english: The Royal Navy battleship HMS Barham was sunk by German U-boats.
sentences.chinese: 英国皇家海军战列舰“巴勒姆号”被德国潜艇击沉。

sentences.english: The Japs claimed a cruiser and a destroyer.
sentences.chinese: 日军声称击沉了1艘巡洋舰和1艘驱逐舰。

sentences.english: Kolchak's fleet was successful at sinking Turkish colliers.
sentences.chinese: 高尔察克的舰队很成功的击沉了土耳其矿船。

sentences.english: And batters the Persian ships with hurricane wind.
sentences.chinese: 用飓风击沉了波斯人的船只。

sentences.english: I do hope that Japan sinks those surveillance ships.
sentences.chinese: 我倒是很希望日本把那些海监船击沉。

sentences.english: The destroyer Hamakaze went down within minutes of the first attack.
sentences.chinese: 浜风号驱逐舰在第一波攻击的几分钟内就被击沉。
